title: Remarkable Birds
description:

Everything you didnâ€™t know about the avian world: a fascinating compendium showcasing the extraordinary wonders of birds, illuminated with exquisite ornithological illustrations, prints, and drawings. Humans share the Earth with more than 10,000 species of birds and have always been enchanted by them. Birds can be a signof the changing seasons, a symbol of freedom, or simply a breathtaking vision of beauty.approaches these fascinating creatures thematically across eight sections covering all aspects of humansâ€™ relationship with birds. â€œSongbirdsâ€ celebrates the greatest bird virtuosi, such as the nightingale, while â€œBirds of Preyâ€ includes majestic hunters such as the harpy eagle. â€œFeathered Travelersâ€ describes astounding journeys made by birds including tiny hummingbirds that migrate huge distances. â€œThe Love Life of Birdsâ€ illuminates the most brilliant displays upon which different species rely to find a mate?notably the extravagant plumage and dances of birds of paradise. â€œAvian Citiesâ€ explores the spectacular, large colonies of species such as the flamingo, while â€œUseful to Usâ€ examines the diverse ways we find birds valuable, such as the turkey or the canary. â€œThreatened & Extinctâ€ describes some species that have been lost forever, and others on the brink. Birds have also had great mystical significance and â€œRevered & Adoredâ€ considers such species as the sacred ibis, believed by the ancient Egyptians to represent the god Thoth.

Remarkable Birds
